item.title: Australian researchers develop breakthrough in solar technology
item.description:
Australian researchers develop breakthrough in solar technology

'Zero-energy' buildings-which generate as much power as they consume-are now much closer after a team at Australia's University of New South Wales achieved the world's highest efficiency using flexible solar cells that are non-toxic and cheap to make.

item.title: London's concrete quarter
item.description:
London's concrete quarter

Source: John Sturrock The transformation of King's Cross includes some of the UK's most sustainable office buildings - and concrete is key to all of them View the latest Concrete Quarterly in full as a digital edition >>> Back to the Concrete Quarterly home page >>> Since the completion of the Olympic Park, King's Cross has had few rivals for its claim to be London's - and arguably the UK's - biggest building site.

item.title: Omnibus House / Gubbins Arquitectos
item.description:
Omnibus House / Gubbins Arquitectos

From the architect. The Omnibus house is located in close proximity to the Quebrada de Aguas Claras, on top of the entrance to Cachagua coming from Laguna de Zapallar, on a gently sloping, surrounded by high and numerous eucalyptus that faces Cachagua and Zapallar surrounding hills, with a distant view of the Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Bamboo Architecture
item.description:
Bamboo Architecture

BALI, Indonesia-How do you build a future out of grass? On the Indonesian island of Bali, one organization has set out to do just that. Ibuku, an architecture and furniture design firm based outside of Denpasar, Bali's capital, is using Dendrocalamus asper bamboo-or petung in Balinese-to construct Green Village.I had the chance to visit this innovative new community while on leave from my Fulbright National Geographic Fellowship in Japan.

item.title: Toronto Green Roofs Are A Must
Sainsbury's supermarket to be powered entirely by its own food waste
item.description:
Sainsbury's supermarket to be powered entirely by its own food waste

Environment It's an unfortunate fact that every day around the world, supermarkets throw out tons of food that has spoiled before it could be purchased. While it would be best if that spoilage could be avoided in the first place, British grocery chain Sainsbury's is taking what might be the next-best approach - it's about to start using that unsellable food to power one of its stores.

item.title: A sustainably built home in rural Ontario
item.description:
A sustainably built home in rural Ontario

After years of city living, Maggie Treanor was ready to move to the country, though she didn't know how far her journey would take her. She first migrated in 2002, from the Ontario city of Guelph to a small town nearby, which "was like going on vacation," she says.

item.title: WELL Building Standard Officially Launches
item.description:
WELL Building Standard Officially Launches

Enhancing people's health and wellness in the built environment is the focus of the WELL standard from the International Well Building Institute.By Tristan Roberts and Paula MeltonThe International Well Building Institute (IWBI) officially launched the WELL Building Standard at its inaugural WELL Building Symposium in New Orleans.
